discourse_list.title: Is it possible for the MKR token voting system to evolve to include additional functionality?

content.content: Recently the Compound governance token was announced that includes a number of new and experimental governance features for a token. Some of these features include:  Vote delegation Historical voting weight per token Minimum tokens to propose  If any or all of these features work out well, is it possible to refactor the MKR voting system to mimic some of these features? Are there any technical limitations on the MKR token itself, or would the technical limitations for these features be on the governance contract? What is the sentiment around the foundation at this time to additional features like those mentioned above?
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is asking for feedback on the possibility of adding new governance features to the MKR token voting system, similar to those found in the Compound governance token. They are also asking about any technical limitations and the sentiment of the foundation towards these features. The post also includes questions for discussion.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
